business-schedule.title: Business to be taken in Westminster Hall
business-schedule.division-heading: Business to be taken in Westminster Hall

business-day.whall-adjournment-debates-introduction: Subjects proposed to be raised on the Motion for the Adjournment:

whall-adjournment-debate-list.whall-adjournment-debate: Unitary proposals for Norfolk, Suffolk and Devon.
No fault liability scheme for minersâ€™ knee.
Opportunities for reduction of NHS expenditure.

business-day.whall-adjournment-debates-introduction: Subjects proposed to be raised on the Motion for the Adjournment:

whall-adjournment-debate-list.whall-adjournment-debate: Home energy efficiency and fuel poverty.
Isle of Wight NHS Primary Care Trust.
whall-adjournment-debate-list.whall-adjournment-debates-intermission: The sitting will be suspended from 11.30 am to 2.30 pm
whall-adjournment-debate-list.whall-adjournment-debate: Situation of private tenants and leaseholders in London.
Closure of the Land Registry Office in Peterborough.

business-item.title: Debate on the Fourth Report from the Foreign Affairs Committee, Session2008-09, on Global Security: Non-proliferation, HC 222, and the Government response, Cm 7692.
Debate on the Third Sector and Government Working Together to Help Communities.
Debate from the Health Committee entitled Patient Safety.

forthcoming-debates.notice: Applications for General or Short Debates should be made in writing to Mr Speaker to reach his office by 10 pm or the rise of House, whichever is the earlier, on Tuesday 2 March. The Ballot will take place on Wednesday 3 March.

Business, Innovation and Skills; Culture, Media and Sport; Foreign and Commonwealth Office; International Development; Minister for the Olympics; Minister for Women and Equality; Northern Ireland; Transport; Treasury; Work and Pensions.
forthcoming-debates.debates-rubric: From the week beginning 15 March 2010 to the week beginning 22 March 2010, Departments will answer adjournment debates in Westminster Hall according to the following rota:
forthcoming-debates.notice: Cabinet Office, Children, Schools and Families; Communities and Local Government; Defence; Energy and Climate Change; Environment, Food and Rural Affairs; Health; Home Office; Justice; Leader of the House; Scotland; Solicitor General; Wales.

Business, Innovation and Skills; Culture, Media and Sport; Foreign and Commonwealth Office; International Development; Minister for the Olympics; Minister for Women and Equality; Northern Ireland; Transport; Treasury; Work and Pensions.
